components.description:
A spiral-bound calendar. Generally depicted as a monthly calendar, with a red or blue header. Apple and Samsung’s pages are curled up at the bottom right, as to flip for a new month.

Like üìÖ Calendar and üìÜ Tear-Off Calendar, commonly used as an icon for specific upcoming events or memorial dates. Also used for various content concerning time, date, schedules, planning, and observances and occasions more generally.

Microsoft, Twitter and Facebook’s design feature a generic month. WhatsApp's design shows in a green header February, when it was incorporated in 2009. Apple, Samsung, and JoyPixels’s designs show the month of July, when World Emoji Day falls on the 17th, a date Google's design used to specifically display.
components.title: Spiral Calendar Pad

title: Spiral Calendar Pad

version.description:
The Unicode Consortium approved the following characters as part of Unicode 7.0, released on June 16, 2014. Support for these emoji characters rely on updates from platform vendors such as Apple, Google, and Microsoft.

Initially, 250 new characters in Unicode 7.0 were approved for emoji presentation, however this was later reduced to 103 Standard Additions which are listed below. The other characters remain part of Unicode, but are not recommended to be included as emojis.

The exception to this was the Left Speech Bubble, and as such wasn't initially specified on other platforms as an emoji. A later-accepted proposal updated this.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> User interface symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Spiral Calendar was approved as part of Unicode 7.0 in 2014 under the name ‚ÄúSpiral Calendar Pad‚Äù and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and pa http://emojipedia.org/spiral-calendar-pad/
emoji_net_data.name: spiral calendar

bn:00093336v: Plan for an activity or event

bn:00083196v: Have the will and intention to carry out some action
To have the intention to carry out some action.

bn:00014705n: An application or tool in the form of an electronic calendar, commonly used for scheduling.
A calendar is a system of organizing days for social, religious, commercial or administrative purposes.
System of organizing days for social, religious, commercial, or administrative purposes.
A system of timekeeping that defines the beginning and length and divisions of the year
The link to the online calendar on Windows Live Calendar.

bn:00001967n: A temporally organized plan for matters to be attended to
A temporally organized plan for matters to be attended to.

bn:00062795n: The act of making contingency plans
The organizational process of creating and maintaining a plan
The act of making a detailed scheme for attaining an objective.
Human capacity for the mental anticipation of action steps that seem necessary to achieve a goal
Planning is the process of thinking about and organizing the activities required to achieve a desired goal.
The act or process of drawing up plans or layouts for some project or enterprise

apple_vendor_description: The spiral calendar emoji on Apple devices presents a visually engaging representation of time, featuring a rolled scroll or calendar with a prominent spiral binding and distinct paper texture, all rendered with Apple's signature 3D shading and realistic lighting. The pages appear slightly worn, hinting at the passage of days, and the overall design evokes a sense of organization and planning. This emoji is ideal for marking dates, appointments, or important events, symbolizing scheduling and the unfolding of time on Apple devices.
